poem:
**Trump IRA for the Young Ones**

In the morning light,  
pennies tumble  
into small hands—  
a promise,  
gleaming coins  
in dreams  
stacked for the years.

A baby's account  
sings futures,  
"big, beautiful"  
they say,  
hopes wrapped  
in gilded wrappers  
for children  
who ride the tremors  
of tomorrow's gains.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "A Trump IRA for kids? It’s worth a bit of money. But here are better options | Gene Marks There’s Trump Mobile, $Trump coins, Trump watches, Trump sneakers and now … the Trump baby savings accounts! Will it be popular? As a financial adviser, I’m not so sure. The Trump IRA (or individual retirement account) was established as a part of the recently passed “big, beautiful bill” and aims to help young people save. Parents". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
